thread.title: YouTube star Todrick Hall releases ‘Hocus Pocus’ parody
thread.title_full: YouTube star Todrick Hall releases ‘Hocus Pocus’ parody - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: YouTube star Todrick Hall releases ‘Hocus Pocus’ parody
text:
todrickhall/via Yotube "Hocus Broke-us" reunites the Sanderson sisters just in time for Halloween. Just in time for Halloween, the Sanderson sisters are black ... or, rather, back.
YouTube star Todrick Hall, famous for his medleys and parody videos, released “Hocus Broke-us” yesterday, featuring Kelly, Michelle and Seyoncé.
The Disney classic “Hocus Pocus” (1993) focuses on three sisters (Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker and Kathy Najimy), witches who are resurrected when Max Dennison lights the Black Flame Candle.
Max, his little sister and his crush Allison are forced to track down and stop the Sandersons before they can suck the life out of all of the children of Salem.
And now, after 22 years touring in the underworld, the Sanderson sisters are back and ready for the 21st century.
“Halloween has never been so ratchet,” the video promises as the witches discover hoverbots, trap music and Fetty Wap.
We even get an updated version of Bette Middler’s performance of “I Put A Spell On You.”
kfeldman@nydailynews.com
